      • SpicesGraphics

        public SpicesGraphics​(java.lang.String anInputStructure,
                      boolean anIsMonomer,
                      int aStartIndex,
                      de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace aFirstParticle,
                      de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace aLastParticle,
                      double aBondLength)
        ** Sets all properties of a Spices object.
        Parameters:
        anInputStructure - An input structure (may be a monomer)
        anIsMonomer - True: anInputStructure is a monomer, false: Otherwise (default: false)
        aStartIndex - First particle number in the Spices matrix (default: 1)
        aFirstParticle - Cartesian coordinate of a single first particle
        aLastParticle - Cartesian coordinate of a single last particle
        aBondLength - User defined bond length for all connections between particles

        aFirstParticle - Cartesian coordinate of a single first particle
        aLastParticle - Cartesian coordinate of a single last particle
        aBondLength - User defined bond length for all connections between particles

    • Method Detail

      • getParticleCoordinates

        public GraphicalParticlePosition[][] getParticleCoordinates​(GraphicalParticlePosition aFirstParticleCoordinate,
                                                            GraphicalParticlePosition aLastParticleCoordinate,
                                                            double aBondLength)
        Returns coordinates of particles
        Parameters:
        aFirstParticleCoordinate - Coordinate of the first particle
        aLastParticleCoordinate - Coordinate of the last particle
        aBondLength - BondLength
        Returns:
        Coordinates of the particles (index of particle can be examined by getParticlesIndex() method). First index is index of molecular structure, second index is index of particle. If PointInSpaceInterface is unknown or different in aFirstParticleCoordinate and aLastParticleCoordinate null is returned.

      • getParticleCoordinates

        public GraphicalParticlePosition[][] getParticleCoordinates​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​IGraphicalParticle> aParticleToGraphicalParticleMap,
                                                            GraphicalParticlePosition aFirstParticleCoordinate,
                                                            GraphicalParticlePosition aLastParticleCoordinate,
                                                            double aBondLength)
        Returns graphical particle positions of particles
        Parameters:
        aParticleToGraphicalParticleMap - HashMap that maps particle to its corresponding graphicalParticle
        aFirstParticleCoordinate - Coordinate of the first particle
        aLastParticleCoordinate - Coordinate of the last particle
        aBondLength - BondLength
        Returns:
        Array of arrays of GraphicalParticlePositions. The index of a particle can be examined by getParticlesIndex() method. First index is the index of the molecular structure, second index is the index of the GraphicalParticlePosition object for the particle position.

      • getParticleCoordinates

        public GraphicalParticlePosition[][] getParticleCoordinates​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​IGraphicalParticle> aParticleToGraphicalParticleMap,
                                                            GraphicalParticlePosition[] aFirstParticleCoordinates,
                                                            GraphicalParticlePosition[] aLastParticleCoordinates,
                                                            double aBondLength)
        Returns graphical particle positions of particles
        Parameters:
        aParticleToGraphicalParticleMap - HashMap that maps particle to its corresponding graphicalParticle
        aFirstParticleCoordinates - Coordinates of the first particle
        aLastParticleCoordinates - Coordinates of the last particle
        aBondLength - BondLength
        Returns:
        Array of arrays of GraphicalParticlePositions. The index of a particle can be examined by getParticlesIndex() method. First index is the index of the molecular structure, second index is the index of the GraphicalParticlePosition object for the particle position.
